title: Tuesday, 20th February, 2018
bodyHTML:
11:05 am
BE11:05am

Hi, hello, good morning, hey. This is Markets Live, FT Alphaville's etc.

Not solo today! Dan joining shortly, possibly.

Manxish Morning
J L Morning
Otter Hello internet friends
BE11:06am

Though I seem to be solo in terms of having no readers. Fine.

Markkus morning
11:05 am

Have a chart.

OnYourRight Morning all

BE11:06am

That's Fidessa.

Blank canvas good morning everyone

VV75 morning

Hello! Good news that the tech works. So, Fidessa ..... initial enthusiasm was of course on results, and 2019 margin guidance.

BE11:07am

11:07 am

DM11:08am

11:08 am

BE11:08am

And then they all read it simultaneously at 3.30pm.

Lemmy Wasn't there some RAW on Fidessa many months ago, rings a bell? Presumably went stale but wonder if today's news is the same dish reheated?
BE11:09am

And it had nothing whatsoever to do with the bid from Temenos that arrived at 6am this morning.

11:08 am
BE11:09am

MAYBE!

Soundbuy Dumped Fidessa on Mifid regs, brexit etc............zzzzz
BE11:09am

Because it's one of those rare Fidessa stories that doesn't seem to have leaked.

Swedish Chef @manx does the budget include VAT on private jets for F1 drivers?
DerivedCategory Morning
BE11:10am

You'll remember slightly more than a year ago there was talk --very well sourced talk -- of PE interest in Fidessa.

Electric Dragon Were there a lot of short-dated out of the money call options being sold? (cf. Levine's 2nd Law of Insider Trading)
Mouselet Good morning assorted miscellaneous people
11:10 am
BE11:10am

Which never got a proper statement, which might lead some to think they went pens down on the leak.

DM11:10am

Were there names, or just general non-specific PE?

BE11:11am

Specific. Advent.

11:11 am
BE11:11am

Which I think bought Misys way back in the day.

BE11:11am

(Another story that leaked, via us.)

BE11:11am

Anyway, the other side of this is with regards Temenos .....

11:12 am
BE11:12am

Which has had punters crawling all over it for several months, on the idea that Softbank was at some stage of building a payments network and loading on all sorts of partners.

Mouselet Quite a lot of weather in the South Pacific at present
erlkin anyone here following the Fannie Mae story in the US.?
BE11:13am

The fact that Temenos has done its biggest acquisition for some considerable time, and that the acquisition is at the hard end of the market -- derivatives trading etc -- would seem to be a bit of a blow to the idea of Softbank coming in and using it for glorified store cards.

BE11:14am

Worth also talking price. It's very high!

11:14 am
BE11:14am

Here's Morgan Stanley.

BE11:14am

The transaction terms work out at just under 4x 2017 sales (growing c. 3% cc), and c. 40x 2017 PE.

BE11:15am

So .... positives are:

11:15 am
BE11:16am

[G]rowth in Temenos's TAM has been driven to a large extent by expanding its product set to address new parts of the financial software vertical. Acquiring Fidessa would add T&CM sell-side equities and derivatives exposure (we estimate this to be greater than c.$3bn of TAM). Temenos's strategy of moving to become a broader banking technology player rather just focusing on the core systems could long term mean it can address the full banking software vertical, at $21bn in FY16 according to Gartner, vs the c.$9bn of TAM Temenos estimated it could address at the time.

#REF! I'm a Fidessa user. The alerting function is broken, had to explain to the lovely helpdesk guy that Fidessa had a RNS at 7am and I didn't get it...
Soundbuy Fannie Mae The Return?
erlkin rbc on IBM....IBM is positioned to see revenue growth (constant currency and reported) and gross-margin expansion in H1:18 at minimum, with optionality that growth could persist through CY18.
BE11:16am

... as well as head office costs and US exposure, which Fidessa has a lot of.

BE11:17am

And in terms of negatives .... it's Fidessa.

11:17 am
BE11:17am

Temenos has seen organic revenue growth accelerate to greater than 12% since FY15 as it looks to be reaching an inflection in adoption of its core banking offering, putting it at the top of our European peer group. In contrast, the more mature sell-side market Fidessa addresses means it has only achieved 3% cc revenue growth in FY16 and FY17. Therefore, we see a risk that combining Temenos's strong structural growth story in core banking with a slower growth story at Fidessa will complicate the equity story.

rwl Morning! Who was it who bought Durex and Dettol. yesterday. somewhat premature - what!
erlkin we had finesse at Cantor....always thought of as a strippers name....fidessa now on stage 4....
#REF! 4x revenues for tech business not outrageous if, and it's a big if, its got loads of growth potential
DM11:18am

3 per cent revenue growth is worth 4 x sales?

#REF! which Fidessa can get... how?
BE11:18am

Yes! Apparently! And more than four-fifths of Fidessa is sellside equities, and it's not obvious what that has to do with banking back office.

Mouselet exactly how has KFC contrived to run out of chicken? Is delivering chicken in fact an impossible logistic issue?
Kiwi-juice @Erlkin is this a sequential revenue growth and or at constant currency? That would be a big trend break
11:18 am
DM11:19am

Huge confidence in sellside equities post mifid 2, clearly

Manxish @Swedish - Nope, although I believe that HM Treasury's report on the application of VAT rules is due in the near future, so maybe next time...
BE11:19am

Hm. You also have the aforementioned Misys, which has tried to build an integrated sellside to back office banking thing under PE ownership and hasn't done very well.

BE11:19am

At least judging by the number of times Misys has pulled its float.

Lemmy Are politicians/Agent Cob going to block this kind of predatory foreign takeover? Foreigners coming over here with their hard currencies and bid premia, something must be done
Mouselet I'm not sure that Fidessa is absolutely the most obvious candidate for nationalisation
AI Hello. There are some rumours floating about On The Beach (OTB). Apparently interest from a US buyer like Expedia. Do you guys have anything on this or heard anything? First post ever btw - hope I get a reply :D
erlkin soudbuy...fannie mae profit was used for Obamacare..it was never going to implode...was more fiscally sound than any of the banks yet the US govt continues to take it's profit stream and leave shareholders at risk of losing everything.. if Trump and Mnunchkin really want to show veritas they would release profits to shareholders....us govt has taken over 271billion from fannie coffers..will it continue...
11:20 am
BE11:20am

UBS was pretty negative as well ... one moment.

BE11:21am

This represents a value of 38x UBSe 2018E earnings and 22x EV/EBITDA, albeit a 2.7% equity FCF yield. We estimate it would lift trailing net debt/EBITDA to 3.5x. It is likely the deal would be accretive (a 2% cost of debt would imply interest costs of £29m relative to EBIT of £50m in 2018) and there may be synergy opportunities in time as Fidessa's 14% margin is relatively low and reflects an average employee cost of £100k vs Temenos at $67k, while its tax rate of 24% compares to Temenos' 17-18%. However Fidessa has averaged just 3%pa underlying growth over the last three years. We question to what extent Temenos would be able to accelerate this given its subscription model and end-market exposures, and even if Fidessa brought a relationship with many Tier 1 banks around the world, leveraging this for core-banking deals may be hard

erlkin Fidessa is a system that enables management to pilfer...imho
Soundbuy @erlkin - haven't been following, interesting...........
BE11:22am

Anyway, Temenos down 7% at pixel. Which is probably in part on overpaying for something with negligible growth and possibly in part on the weight of speculative money that had stacked up into it on the Softbank thing.

11:23 am
DM11:23am

Dangerous thing to have around, Softbank, an all purpose price insensitive buyer of everything.

DM11:23am

Sorry, rumoured buyer of everything

BE11:24am

Softbank is now the generic rumour, like "Saudis" were a few years back, and "Chinese" soon after.

Soundbuy FDSA - short position only 1.26%, thankfully for some......
trc Has Agent COB joined the GKN bid defence team?
11:24 am
BE11:25am

It'll be Softbank for Imperial Tobacco in the [insert name of paper here] market report before the year's out. I nearly guarantee it.

HSBC Holdings PLC (HSBA:LSE): Last: 732.90, down 27.6 (-3.63%), High: 742.00, Low: 726.20, Volume: 20.83m

Indeed. And they're even more incomprehensible than usual, in fact, because you have a very large jump in bad loans that they don't (and can't) identify even though we all know it's Steinhoff and Carillion.

erlkin more on ibm....improvement in services performance and revenue mix (GBS and Tech Services segments), cost improvements from prior initiatives (services delivery), normalization of transactional mix (cognitive), and scale/efficiency benefits in X-as-a-service. Fundamentally, to the extent that IBM can show gross-margin stability/improvement, investors would get more comfortable with owning IBM for 2018 and beyond. Net/Net: We maintain our Outperform rating and $180 price target, as we see high probability that IBM can show a confluence of organic growth and gross-margin expansion in H1:18 and potentially through CY18 in its entirety as well.

11:29 am
BE11:29am

Anyway, consensus was too high and in underlying terms it's pretty weak as well.

BE11:29am

JP Morgan Caz for the summary.

BE11:30am

HSBC’s Q4’17 results show decent growth momentum with loan growth of +7% y/y and NII up c4% Q/Q on an underlying basis and flat net interest margin. However, adj. PBT at 8% is below company-compiled consensus expectations driven by Revenues coming in 1% below consensus and Costs 1% higher. We note that group revenue of $12.4bn included c$0.2bn of negative items and Costs of $8.8bn included $0.3bn of investment for growth. Although the group did not announce a new buyback program, we believe that with CT1 at 14.5% and the US DPA lifted, another potential $3bn buyback is possible later in 2018 which would ultimately offset the dilution from share issuance for the scrip dividend. In our view, HSBC shares are fully valued at 1.3x P/B for 2019 RoE of 7.7% and a dividend yield of 4.8%. We continue to prefer StanChart (top pick).

FATDAZ @Shinsin interesting but ws tat offset by a near monopolistic position in equity trading ?

DM11:44am

In Taste & Nutrition, the company reported a 7.1% increase in trading profit to €767.2m (€766.5m forecast) from a 5.7%
increase in revenue to €5.16bn (€5.12bn expected). LFL revenue growth of 6.7% (6.8% forecast) was driven by a solid
4.7% increase in volumes (4.7% forecast), augmented by a 2.0% increase in pricing (2.1% forecast). At the reported line,
revenue grew 5.7% as a 0.9% contribution from acquisitions (0.7% forecast) was tempered by a 1.9% FX headwind (-2.2%
expected). The Consumer Products division reported a 7.9% decrease in trading profit to €107.8m (€108.0m forecast) from
a 0.1% decrease in revenue to €1.33bn (€1.34bn expected). LFL revenue growth of 3.5% (2.4% volume; 2.0%
pricing; -0.9% transactional FX) was behind forecasts (+4.4% of which 2.5% volume, 1.9% pricing). The small reported
revenue decline reflected strong FX headwinds (-3.8% versus -3.9% expected). On a geographic basis, Asia Pacific
continues to be the main growth driver (+13.1% reported, 12.9% LFL) while EMEA is continuing to recover, recording
strong 6.2% revenue growth (7.6% LFL).

Online travel agent On The Beach Group has hired heavyweight investment bankers amid fears it may be vulnerable to a £1bn takeover bid.

Advisers from NM Rothschild were brought in late last year, amid rumours a bid could be in the offing from a US travel website such as Expedia.

No such bid has emerged, in spite of activity in the sector. City sources claim Rothschild is also advising on possible acquisition for On the Beach.

BCA Marketplace plc, (LSE:BCA), Europe's leading automotive business services group, announces the appointment of Goldman Sachs International and Numis Securities as Joint Brokers to the Company. Both appointments take immediate effect.

The Joint Brokers to the Company now comprise Goldman Sachs International, Cenkos Securities and Numis Securities.

BE11:59am

I'd also note that BCA seems to have caught the attention of some bears. Some outfit called Stockviews has been critical of late.

BE11:59am

While BCA has delivered impressive top line growth since the 2015 listing, we argue the market has overlooked an ongoing shift in the business model. The attractive capital-light exchange is giving way to a business that requires far more working capital to grow and increases BCA’s exposure to used car pricing. Furthermore, the previously dominant position of physical auctions is under pressure, driving down core fees. In the driver’s seat is a CEO whose motives have been, and still are, misaligned with long term shareholders. With returns falling from here, we see 55% downside to intrinsic value. In a scenario where used car prices fall back to 2013 levels, downside grows to 75%.
